It has been stated many, many times that $ XRP was not created by Ripple. They are holders of XRP, but they are not the creators.https://xrpcommunity.blog/the-founders-agreement/ …

You’re the dude who wrote the creepy CoinDesk article about @ Ripple’s # XRPCommunity night event! You wrote it from the point of view of a stalker: “Then I spotted her, $ XRP Twitter's Defender of the Faith, Tiffany Hayden”
When I do # Bitcoin outreach, I’m called an evangelist. When I correct $ XRP misinformation, I’m called a Jehovah's Witness. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯pic.twitter.com/qPzo5LXfLR

You have no idea if that’s all Satoshi holds. The top 20 addresses could belong to one entity. The top 100 addresses could belong to one entity. All of the information regarding Ripple’s holdings is public and on the ledger. DYOR.

So, there are people who hold shares of Ripple stock -employees and investors. If an investor wants to sell his stock, he has to do it on the second market. From what I’ve seen, it’s private and new buyers (accredited investors only) aren’t given any info.

How many Bitcoin does Satoshi hold? Can you chart Coinbase’s Bitcoin & ETH holdings for me too please. Oh, that’s right. Only Ripple provides transparency about their holdings. Everyone else is assigned a fairytale.
RippleNet and the XRP Ledger are 2 different things. You would know this if you had bothered reading the article I must have posted 5 times now for you.

In Ripple Consensus, every server processes every txn according to the same deterministic rules. The analogous component of Bitcoin is the choice of which transactions to include in a block. What cryptography do you think secures this?

You post a lot for such a confused soul. Consider reading. RippleNet is a payments group. I think you meant to bitch about the XRP Ledger but lack the intelligence to do so. Pity.https://xrpcommunity.blog/what-is-ripple/
I’ve never been paid to promote Ripple or XRP. Ever.
You can’t invest in the company Ripple unless you’re an accredited investor willing to buy stock on the second market.

The researchers found that Tether, the secondary cryptocurrency created by Bitfinex, was actually responsible for more trading in the crypto markets than was the US dollar.

When people raised concern about this last year they were primarily concerned about the impact the manipulation might have had on the price of Bitcoin. These researchers found that it had an even bigger impact on other tokens like Ether and Zcash.

A pair of academics have found evidence that at least half of the big gains in Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies last year were a result of manipulation connected to the largest exchange at the time, Bitfinex -https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/13/technology/bitcoin-price-manipulation.html …
